Hello deepa !

Did you find a solution to your problem? 
I'm trying to extr=
act html/css/image contents from a page, and it seems I have the same probl=
em with the "NotMatchesFilePatternDecideRule"
Thanks

Jerome

--- In archiv=
e-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "DEEPA R" <deeparaka@...> wrote:
>
> 
> Hi, 
> 
=
> I am trying to narrow my crawl by allowing only css types of files to be =
accepted. For this I am using the "NotMatchesFilePatternDecideRule" with th=
e properties like :
> 
>   <bean class=3D"org.archive.modules.deciderules.N=
otMatchesFilePatternDecideRule">
>       <property name=3D"decision" value=
=3D"REJECT" />
>       <property name=3D"regex" value=3D".*(/|\.css)$" /> 
=
>  </bean>
> 
> with the other rules in this order , as on the manual :
> 
=
>    1. RejectDecideRule
>    2. SurtPrefixedDecideRule
>    3. TooManyHops=
DecideRule
>    4. PathologicalPathDecideRule
>    5. TooManyPathSegmentsDe=
cideRule
>    6. NotMatchesFilePatternDecideRule
>    7. PrerequisiteAccept=
DecideRule
> 
> But I am getting all types of files like pdf , images and n=
ot getting the css files . I am not able to figure out where am I going wro=
ng. Any help is greatly appreciated.
> 
> Thanks.
>
